Finding A: Wealth in late life associated with dementia risk in England Pleased to see our paper published @username with Prof Andrew Steptoe @username Prof David Batty @username @username & @username
Finding B: In contrast, paternal age showed a U-shaped relationship, with the offspring of teenaged fathers having a 28% increased risk for a psychiatric disorder (IRR, 1.28 [95% CI, 1.24-1.32]), whereas the offspring of the fathers 45 years or older had a 34% increased risk (1.34 [1.30-1.39]).
Finding C: Activation of the medial prefrontal cortex in all three tasks may suggest a role in representation of affective meaning for the religious stimuli and suggests that cognitive attribution and judgment of the meaning or value of religious stimuli contributes to their experience.

Psychology_121_r$Psychology_tweet_1_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: A spike in cortisol in athletesa saliva before competition, they wrote, would support the idea that apsychosocial stressorsa can have as strong a biological effect as actual danger.
Finding B: Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Finding C: In line with our hypothesis, the male partner\'s empathic accuracy significantly moderated the effect of touch on synchronization for respiration fluctuations (F (4,28000) = 27.87, p < 0.0001, ΔBIC = 419439.8, ΔR 2 = 0.23).
Finding D: DBT for High Suicide Risk in Borderline Personality Disorder

Psychology_146_p$Psychology_74_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Conclusions: Overall, the findings of this study reveal disruptions in the brain circuitry underlying ToM in ASD at multiple levels, including decreased activation and decreased functional connectivity.
Finding B: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
Finding C: This implies that there is a similar psychological mechanism for people higher and lower in cognitive ability, such as the effects of attitude dissimilarity or in-group/ out-group distinctions on prejudice .
Finding D: Furthermore, we found an impact of labels on intensity ratings for one of the administered odors that goes against our hypothesis.
Psychology_146_p$Psychology_74_r$Psychol.displayed_text:
Finding A: Conclusions: Overall, the findings of this study reveal disruptions in the brain circuitry underlying ToM in ASD at multiple levels, including decreased activation and decreased functional connectivity.
Finding B: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
Finding C: This implies that there is a similar psychological mechanism for people higher and lower in cognitive ability, such as the effects of attitude dissimilarity or in-group/ out-group distinctions on prejudice .
Finding D: Furthermore, we found an impact of labels on intensity ratings for one of the administered odors that goes against our hypothesis.

Psychology_tweet_55_p$Psychology_9_r$Psy.text:
Finding A: We note that the causal relations between sleep and depression is an important topic that deserves much further investigation.
Finding B: The researchers say that the pain associated with circumcision in very young babies is likely to be more severe during the operation and post-operatively.
Finding C: The study discovered that, regardless of their cultural background, circumcised boys could be at greater risk of developing the condition.
Finding D: Given expectations for continued growth in the number of young adults with an ASD entering adulthood, urgent consideration should be given to employment preparation that is consistent with the current labor market in order to facilitate employment and minimize costs to society.
